III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158: Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff picked up youth and threw him on bed.
Investigation *There is not video footage of the alleged incident.
Interviews:
Complainant 1:
I spoke to Complainant 1 via telephone on 8/7/23 and no new
allegations were reported.
Administrator 1:
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 8/7/23 face to face at the facility.
Administrator 1 reported that Youth A is nervous about leaving the
facility and she feels that he made this allegation up, hoping to
stay at the facility.
Youth A:
Youth A reported he was not following expectations. Youth A
reported he was cussing at staff and removing staffs’ shoes.
Youth A reported he was in his bedroom and Staff 1 picked him up
and threw him on his bed. Youth A reported it hurt “a little” then he
went outside. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 went
outside looking for him. Youth A reported Staff 1 has never done
this before. Youth A was not able to provide any other specific
details concerning the incident.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported he was working on Youth A’s unit but not directly
with Youth A. Youth A was arguing with staff and stating he was
going to “whoop ass.” Staff 1 reported he then came over to help
the other staff due to Youth A’s behaviors. Staff 1 reported that
Youth A was in his bedroom when he came down to help. Staff 1
reported he redirected Youth A and Youth A attempted to push
Staff 1 out of the way. Youth A was able to get pass Staff 1 and
went AWOL outside. Staff 1 reported he followed him outside and
Supervisor 1 came out to help. Youth A was outside and once he
calmed down, Youth A came back inside. Staff 1 reported he
2

never pushed Youth A and Youth A was never on the bed in his
bedroom.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he did not see the incident while Youth A
was in his bedroom. Supervisor 1 reported that he witnessed
Youth A outside with Staff 1. Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1
was controlled and even tempered while outside. Once Youth A
went back into the building, he voluntarily went into his room.
Supervisor 1 reported when he checked on Youth A later in the
evening he never complained or stated anyone hurt him or threw
him on the bed.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported Youth A was upset and pushing on staff. Staff 2
reported the only time Staff 1 touched Youth A was when Staff 1
guided Youth A back to his room. Staff 2 reported Youth A went
voluntarily into his room. Staff 2 reported that when he was
present he did not see anyone push Youth A or throw him.
I reviewed the Incident Reports for the date of the incident, 8/3/23.
All incident reports align with staff interviews.
I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All trainings and clearances
were up to date.
The other State Department had no findings.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate Youth A was picked up and
thrown on his bed. Staff 1 and Staff 2, as well as Supervisor 1
were able to articulate well Youth A’s behaviors and the
interventions they used to deescalate Youth A.
Conclusion Violation not Established.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
